meanings.definition: To subject (wine) to a process of oxidation, as by exposure to air.
meanings.sent1: The winemaker was maderizing the wine to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent2: Winemakers often use the technique of maderizing to improve the taste of certain wines.
meanings.sent3: After maderizing the wine, it gained a richer and more complex taste.
meanings.sent4: The process of maderizing the wine transformed it into a delightful and aromatic drink.
meanings.sent5: Through maderizing, the wine acquired a unique and desirable character.
